com.sata_bank.myposcheckout.ipc.request

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sata_bank.myposcheckout.ipc.request.Request
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InAppPurchase, InAppStoreCard, InAppStoredCardUpdate, MandateManagement, Purchase, Refund, RequestMoney, Reversal, TransactionLog, TransactionStatus

    public abstract class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    Base API request class. Contains basic API connection methods.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Config config
      Configuration object for the API communication
      protected CommunicationFormat outputFormat
      Output format from the API (for some requests may be XML or JSON)

      • createSignature

        public java.lang.String createSignature()
                                 throws IPCException
        Create a signature for the API request parameters using the store private key.
        Returns:
        a base64 encoded signature
        Throws:
        IPCException - If for some reason (invalid private key, invalid signature generation algorithm, etc.) the signature could not be created.

      • getSignedRequestParams

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> getSignedRequestParams()
                                                                          throws IPCException
        Returns all the API request parameters and generates a signature for them, if one is not present.
        Returns:
        all the API request parameters with a generated signature for them
        Throws:
        IPCException - if the signature could not be generated

      • createApiCallFormHtml

        public java.lang.String createApiCallFormHtml(java.lang.String title,
                                              java.lang.String content)
                                       throws IPCException
        Creates a minimal HTML document, containing a form with all the request parameters. The form will automatically submit the data when the document is loaded. This is used because the API requires the user to be redirected to the MyPOS site with a POST request.
        Parameters:
        title - the page title
        content - the page content
        Returns:
        a HTML string containing the form
        Throws:
        IPCException - If the signature for the request parameters could not be generated.

      • createApiCallFormHtml

        public java.lang.String createApiCallFormHtml(java.lang.String title)
                                       throws IPCException
        Creates a minimal HTML document, containing a form with all the request parameters. The form will automatically submit the data when the document is loaded. This is used because the API requires the user to be redirected to the MyPOS site with a POST request.
        Parameters:
        title - the page title
        Returns:
        a HTML string containing the form
        Throws:
        IPCException - If the signature for the request parameters could not be generated.

      • createApiCallFormHtml

        public java.lang.String createApiCallFormHtml()
                                       throws IPCException
        Creates a minimal HTML document, containing a form with all the request parameters. The form will automatically submit the data when the document is loaded. This is used because the API requires the user to be redirected to the MyPOS site with a POST request.
        Returns:
        a HTML string containing the form
        Throws:

      • processApiCall

        protected BasicResponse processApiCall()
                                throws IPCException
        Makes a request to the API using and returns the decoded API response.
        Returns:
        a Response object, containing the API response data
        Throws:
        IPCException - If the signature for the request parameters could not be generated. If the API endpoint URL is invalid. If a connection with the API could not be established. If the API endpoint responds with an status code different than java.​net.​HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK. If the data returned by the API contains an invalid signature.
